subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Maybe this is clearer?
author: RetroCom
full_text:
The file came through very clear Frank. It would be great to have instructions on modifying a modern radio like you mentioned. I don't think I have a radio in the house any newer then 1979 vintage (ha). BTW I am still testing the manual linear 'spin' technique. The faster the spin of the dial the more 'spikey' the voices become. Makes me wonder if modulated pulses chosen randomly would also work. I have a crude 5 channel optical switch and will test this theory during the weekend.

Dave

--- franks-boxes@... wrote:

From: "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Maybe this is clearer?
Date: Wed, 28 Mar 2007 12:44:50 -0600

I don;t like the way the image looks after converting to jpeg, all smudgy, 
so I'm seeing if zipping is more better. I used Freezip.

This one is re-drawn from scratch, using the original trangle generator 
schematic I found on line for reference. I added the output buffer, made the 
frequency adjustable, and use a different chip for it. This is what I do for 
all my circuits, modifying as needed.

The point of this circuit is to use Retro Dave's limear tuning experiment 
with voltage tunable radios, incase anyone has one like I use lying 
around.......doh. Think I'm going to have to do a proceedure on modifying an 
existing radio for voltage tuning.

Frank
